title: Losses at FT owner Pearson widen as US woes deepen
text:

Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 09:31 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 59 mins Losses at FT owner Pearson widen as US woes deepen By Ben Martin | Telegraph – 8 minutes ago 18.21 -0.59 
The textbooks company, which on Thursday sold the Financial Times for £844m, has been hurt by a slowdown in the US 
Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) , the education giant that on Thursday revealed the £844m sale of the Financial Times , has revealed that losses widened during the first half of the year following a further slowdown in sales of textbooks in the US. 
The FTSE 100 company, which has been exiting its media businesses to focus on its education operations, slumped to a £115m pre-tax loss for the six months to the end of June, compared with a £36m loss a year earlier. That was despite revenues edging up to £2.16bn from £2.05bn during the same period. 
Pearson sells textbooks, examinations and online teaching tools and said that its North American business was hurt by "a smaller new textbook adoption market in US schools and the phasing of school textbook expenditure". 
The US is its biggest market and accounts for 60pc of revenues. Analysts said on Friday that they were concerned the company had glossed over its mounting problems in the region with its latest set of results. 
"There seemed a reluctance in the statement to address key issues facing the company, including the mounting problems in the US around schools' testing and a sharp worsening in the outlook for the for-profits US higher education space," said analysts at Liberum. 
They added: "In its outlook statement, Pearson skipped over completely the issues of their testing problems in the US where they have lost a number of contracts."
